intro: Angianthus microcephalus, commonly known as the dwarf angianthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is also known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens.
